publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-147♦ David Stewart: National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007—That the Parliament welcomes the Small Change, Big Difference campaign being run by Diabetes UK Scotland for National Diabetes Week 2007; commends the tremendous support that Diabetes UK Scotland gives to the estimated 173,000 people in Scotland who are living with diabetes; notes that, in the Highlands alone, the number of people living with diabetes stands at 11,111 and this figure is predicted to rise to at least 13,000 by 2017, and therefore considers that the Scottish Diabetes Framework Action Plan should be delivered by 2009, as set out in the Diabetes UK Scotland Manifesto 2007.

S3M-147*#* David Stewart: National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007—That the Parliament welcomes the Small Change, Big Difference campaign being run by Diabetes UK Scotland for National Diabetes Week 2007; commends the tremendous support that Diabetes UK Scotland gives to the estimated 173,000 people in Scotland who are living with diabetes; notes that, in the Highlands alone, the number of people living with diabetes stands at 11,111 and this figure is predicted to rise to at least 13,000 by 2017, and therefore considers that the Scottish Diabetes Framework Action Plan should be delivered by 2009, as set out in the Diabetes UK Scotland Manifesto 2007. Supported by: Peter Peacock*, Rhoda Grant*, Andy Kerr*, Sarah Boyack*, Tavish Scott*, Marlyn Glen*, Liam McArthur*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mike Pringle*, Jackie Baillie*, John Lamont*, Michael McMahon*, Patricia Ferguson*, Elaine Murray*, Elaine Smith*, Bill Butler*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Des McNulty*, John Park* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Bill Wilson*, Ken Macintosh*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Kenneth Gibson*, Karen Gillon*, Mary Mulligan*, Trish Godman*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Christine Grahame*, Robin Harper*, George Foulkes*, Irene Oldfather*
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Dr Richard Simpson*
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Margaret Mitchell*
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Nanette Milne*
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Angela Constance*, Cathy Peattie*

S3M-147# David Stewart: National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007—That the Parliament welcomes the Small Change, Big Difference campaign being run by Diabetes UK Scotland for National Diabetes Week 2007; commends the tremendous support that Diabetes UK Scotland gives to the estimated 173,000 people in Scotland who are living with diabetes; notes that, in the Highlands alone, the number of people living with diabetes stands at 11,111 and this figure is predicted to rise to at least 13,000 by 2017, and therefore considers that the Scottish Diabetes Framework Action Plan should be delivered by 2009, as set out in the Diabetes UK Scotland Manifesto 2007. Supported by: Peter Peacock, Rhoda Grant, Andy Kerr, Sarah Boyack, Tavish Scott, Marlyn Glen, Liam McArthur, Mr Jamie Stone, Mike Pringle, Jackie Baillie, John Lamont, Michael McMahon, Patricia Ferguson, Elaine Murray, Elaine Smith, Bill Butler, Malcolm Chisholm, Marilyn Livingstone, Des McNulty, John Park, Bill Wilson, Ken Macintosh, Hugh O’Donnell, Kenneth Gibson, Karen Gillon, Mary Mulligan, Trish Godman, Hugh Henry, Christine Grahame, Robin Harper, George Foulkes, Irene Oldfather, Dr Richard Simpson, Margaret Mitchell, Nanette Milne, Angela Constance, Cathy Peattie
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Robert Brown* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-147# National Diabetes Week, 10 to 16 June 2007 (lodged on 8 June 2007) Jack McConnell*, Karen Whitefield*
